categoryData.displaySubtitle: Activating my card, my nearest ATM...

subCategories.displayName: What can my Monzo card do?

helpArticles.question: How can I use my Monzo card?

answer.answer:
You can use your card to pay for anything with money from your Monzo account. The first time you use it, you'll need to pay by Chip and PIN, but after that you can use your card to make online and contactless payments as well.

In some countries they use magnetic stripe, or 'Magstripe', payments when they swipe your card. You can pay this way with your Monzo card, but we keep the option switched off by default because Magstripe payments aren't as safe. 

To switch them on temporarily, head to the "Account" tab in your app, then select the 'Manage' icon underneath your card üòä
Yes, we do! You'll be prompted to use it when specific merchants request that you use 3DS when making online transactions.

Magstripe is a type of security that was common in the UK before chip and PIN. It uses information in the black strip on the back of your card to make payments.

It‚Äôs still very common in some parts of the world, but __Magstripe is not as safe__ as chip and PIN because fraudsters can easily ‚Äòclone‚Äô the stripe. So we don‚Äôt automatically let you use your card with Magstripe card machines or ATMs. 

If you need to use Magstripe at an ATM, you can switch it on for 7 days from the 'Manage' button on your Account tab. Or, if you need access for longer, chat to us in the app.

helpArticles.question: Is my Monzo card accepted everywhere?

answer.answer:
Your card should work anywhere that Mastercard is accepted. 

Unfortunately some merchants don't keep their systems up to date, so we occasionally see situations where our cards aren‚Äôt recognised. We have a team dedicated towards resolving issues like this, so please [let us know if you have an issue](monzo://support_chat?from=button-help-article "let us know if you have an issue").

We do find some occasional issues in countries like Cuba, Portugal, North and South Korea, and Bulgaria. Our help screen and our community forum are the best places to ask check about specific locations. You can find our forum using the button below üòä

helpArticles.question: Can I take out cash on my Monzo card?

answer.answer:
You can use your card at any Mastercard ATM (you should be able to see the small Mastercard logo on it).

To find Mastercard ATM's, just follow the link below üöÄ

https://www.mastercard.us/en-us/consumers/get-support/locate-an-atm.html

helpArticles.question: Is my Monzo card a credit card?

answer.answer: No, your Monzo card is a Mastercard debit card.

For security reasons, __we only let you have one active personal account card at a time__. So if you have a card for your personal account that works, you won‚Äôt be able to get a second one.

If you‚Äôve lost or damaged your card, please freeze it in the app from your "Home" tab by tapping "Freeze" under your card (if you can't see the freeze button, swipe down on the transactions list). 

If you'd like to open a joint account, head to your Profile (iOS) or Settings (Android) and you'll be able to invite your joint account co-owner to open a new account with you.

helpArticles.question: Can I pay with a frozen card?

answer.answer:
When you freeze your card, we‚Äôll block all payments we can so you won‚Äôt be able to use your card in most situations. That includes anything through Google or Apple Pay. If you‚Äôve frozen your card and see any strange activity, please [get in touch with us and we‚Äôll investigate](monzo://support_chat?from=button-help-article "get in touch with us").

You can unfreeze your card by tapping 'Unfreeze' under your card on the Home tab.

helpArticles.question: Reporting a lost, damaged or stolen card

answer.answer:
If your card's lost, damaged or stolen, it's easy to order a new one üíÅ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

1. Tap the __Home__ icon in the menu bar
2. Tap the __Account__ button under your Monzo card (if you can't find this button, swipe down on your list of payments)
3. Tap __My card is lost or stolen__ or __My card is damaged or broken__

__Reporting a stolen card üí≥__

If your card's been stolen, or you've seen transactions that look fraudulent, please make sure your card stays frozen until your replacement arrives. You should also tell us about this in the app: 

1. Tap the __Help__ icon in the menu bar
2. Search ‚ÄòReporting a lost, damaged or stolen card‚Äô
3. Tap __get in touch__ near the end of the article

helpArticles.question: I want to update my delivery address

answer.answer:
When you order a Monzo card, you can enter the address you‚Äôd like us to send it to.

If you change your mind once you‚Äôve ordered it, you‚Äôll need to chat with us to get your address updated.

We send Monzo cards by Royal Mail 1st Class. 90% of cards arrive the next day (if you order before 3pm on a weekday), but it can take 2-5 working days if Royal Mail's busier than usual üìÆ

Here‚Äôs how to check your card's status (and reorder it if you need to):

1. Tap the __Home__ icon in the menu bar
2. Tap the __Account__ button under your Monzo card (if you can't find this button, swipe down on your list of payments)
3. Tap __Your card order__

**If you haven't activated your new card in your app**

You can activate it here: [Activate your card](monzo://activate_replacement)

**If you can see a decline message in your app**

Tap on the declined payment in your app for more information. If the decline message is unclear, please chat to us.

**If your card doesn't work at a particular merchant, but other cards do**

It's likely the merchant hasn't configured their systems correctly to accept our cards. In this case you won't even see a decline message in your app.

We can reach out to them for you to try and fix the issue.

Please [chat to us](monzo://support_chat?from=button-help-article) and provide:

1. The **name of the merchant or ATM provider** where your card's been declined
2. The **address** of the store or ATM (or web address if your card is declined online)
3. The **time and date** of the attempted payment
4. The **amount** of the attempted payment
5. A **receipt or screenshot** showing a decline or a successful payment with a different card ****(We can use this to diagnose the exact issue with the merchant's payment systems)
6. A **brief summary** of what happened

helpArticles.question: Why are my contactless card payments being declined?

answer.answer:
After every few contactless payments, you'll need to retry with Chip & PIN. Once you've paid with Chip & PIN, contactless payments will work again. This is because of new security rules, affecting all banks. 

Some places might not be ready for this change yet, so will show a regular decline message. We'll send you a notification when you need to retry with Chip & PIN, and let you know in advance if your next payment needs to use Chip & PIN.

These rules don't affect Apple Pay and Google Pay payments, or Transport for London payments where chip & PIN isn't available.

helpArticles.question: My card payment declined, but I've still been charged

answer.answer:
If the payment declined on the merchant's end but went through on your app, this might be because of a problem with their card machine.

To get your money back:

- Pick the payment you'd like to question
- Scroll down and tap 'Something wrong? Tell us!'
- you can either question the payment and get your money back straightaway. Or you can wait and automatically get the money back in 7 days.

__If you're new to Monzo:__

1. Tap the __Home__ icon in the menu bar
2. Tap __Activate My Card__

__If you've ordered a replacement card:__

1. Tap the __Home__ icon in the menu bar
2. Tap __Activate new card__ underneath your Monzo card (if you can't find this button, swipe down on your list of payments)

To freeze and defrost your card, head to your "Account" screen and tap the ‚Äò__Freeze__‚Äô or ‚Äò__Defrost__‚Äô icons seen under your card.

It‚Äôll happen instantly ‚ùÑÔ∏è

When you get you order a Monzo card, you need to activate it in the app. 

It's rare, but sometimes contactless doesn't activate. If you have this issue, make a Chip & PIN transaction and then contactless will work.

__If you've done both of these steps and your card's contactless still doesn't work well, order a replacement by freezing your card, and then selecting 'replace'__ üòä

Forgotten your PIN? No worries üôÇ

1. Tap the __Home__ icon in the menu bar
2. Tap the __PIN & card number__ button under your Monzo card (if you can't find this button, swipe down on your list of payments)
3. Tap __Get a PIN reminder__

You'll need to show some ID and take a photo of your face üì∏

In the future, you can save time by using your fingerprint or face to confirm it‚Äôs you when logging in.

You can change your PIN at the cash machine of any major high street bank (Barclays, HSBC, Lloyds, etc.) by choosing ‚ÄòPIN services‚Äô üè¶ 

You can also change it at some cash machines in other countries. We recommend doing it in the UK if you can, because there‚Äôs a chance it won‚Äôt work abroad.

If you put the wrong PIN in too many times when making a transfer or changing your account settings, we‚Äôll block it to keep your account safe. 

__To unblock it, head to your "Account" tab, then tap on ‚Äònumbers‚Äô. __

You‚Äôll need your card with you, to put in the 3-digit CVC code on the back. Follow the instructions, and we‚Äôll unblock your PIN ‚Äì it usually takes less than 10 minutes
